204.description: 2.04 Changed respond with required and optional information

delete.description:
Delete a device. This also removes all resources in the device on cloud side. Access token is required only if the TLS connection to the cloud is not authorized - see oic.sec.session.
example: /oic/account?di=9cfbeb8e-5a1e-4d1c-9d01-00c04fd430c8&accesstoken=0f3d9f7fe5491d54077d

202.description: 2.02 Deleted response informing the device is successfully deleted.

authprovider.description: The name of Authorization Provider through which Access Token was obtained.

accesstoken.description: Access Token used to authorize and associate the TLS connection for communication with the OCF Cloud with the Device ID, or the Authorization Code which is then verified and exchanged for the Access Token during Device Registration.

di.description: Unique Device identifier. Format pattern according to IETF RFC 4122.

expiresin.description: Access Token life time in seconds (-1 if permanent).

refreshtoken.description: Refresh token can be used to refresh the Access Token before getting expired.

uid.description: Unique OCF Cloud User identifier. Format pattern according to IETF RFC 4122.

accesstoken.description: Access Token used to authorize and associate the TLS connection for communication with the OCF Cloud with the Device ID.

redirecturi.description: Using this URI, the Client needs to reconnect to a redirected OCF Cloud. If provided, this value shall be used by the Device instead of Mediator-provided URI during the Device Registration.

if.description: The interface set supported by this resource
